intro: Gaiadendron breviflorum, commonly known as the short-flowered gaiadendron, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow or white in color. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and branched. Gaiadendron breviflorum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
